post.description: Registers a new user in the system under the authenticated tenant. User is assigned 'guest' role by default. Email must be unique within tenant. Password is hashed with Argon2.

parameters.description: User registration details: name (required), email (required), password (required)
parameters.name: request

200.description: User registered successfully with default 'guest' role

400.description: Bad request, missing required fields (name, email, or password)

409.description: Conflict, user with this email already exists in tenant

500.description: Internal server error

post.description: Authenticates a user and returns a JWT token upon successful login. Requires email, password, and role to be provided.

parameters.description: User login credentials including email, password, and role
parameters.name: body

403.description: Forbidden, user doesn't have required role

422.description: Error while parsing the request body

500.description: Unexpected server error

put.description: Logs out the logged in user and invalidates its existing token.

401.description: Unauthorized, invalid or missing JWT token

500.description: Unexpected server error

put.description: Refreshes and returns a new JWT token for the authenticated user. Requires a valid JWT token to be provided.

200.description: Refreshed JWT token and success message

401.description: Unauthorized, invalid or missing JWT token

500.description: Unexpected server error

get.description: Retrieves all roles from the system with pagination support. Filter roles by type using 'roleTypeFlag' query parameter ('custom' or 'default'). Includes role routes in response.

parameters.description: Role type to filter: 'custom' or 'default'. If not provided, defaults to 'custom'.
parameters.name: roleTypeFlag

parameters.description: Page number (default: 1)
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Number of items per page (default: 5)
parameters.name: page_size

200.description: Roles fetched successfully with pagination metadata. Data includes role details and associated routes.

400.description: Bad request. Invalid roleTypeFlag parameter (must be 'custom' or 'default').

500.description: Internal server error. This occurs if there is an unexpected error while fetching roles.

post.description: Creates a new custom role with specified permissions. Requires name, display_name, description, and permissions array with route, methods, and description for each permission.

parameters.description: Create Custom Role Request. Requires 'name', 'display_name', 'description', and 'Permissions' array.
parameters.name: request

400.description: Bad Request. This occurs if required fields (name, display_name, description, or Permissions) are missing or invalid.

409.description: Conflict. This occurs if a role with the same name already exists.

422.description: Unprocessable Entity. This occurs if the request body cannot be parsed.

500.description: Internal server error. This occurs if there is an unexpected error while creating the role.

delete.description: Deletes a custom role by its ID. Only custom roles can be deleted; system/default roles are protected. The role must not be currently assigned to any users.

parameters.description: Role ID to delete. Must be a valid UUID format.
parameters.name: id

400.description: Bad Request. This occurs if the 'id' path parameter is missing, empty, or not a valid UUID format.

404.description: Not Found. This occurs if no role exists with the provided ID or if trying to delete a default/system role.

500.description: Internal server error. This occurs if there is an unexpected error while deleting the role.

put.description: Disables a role by its ID, preventing it from being assigned to new users. Existing users with this role will retain it but new assignments are blocked. System/default roles cannot be disabled.

parameters.description: Role ID to disable. Must be a valid UUID format.
parameters.name: id

400.description: Bad Request. This occurs if the 'id' path parameter is missing, empty, or not a valid UUID format.

403.description: Forbidden. This occurs if trying to modify a system/default role.

404.description: Not Found. This occurs if no role exists with the provided ID.

409.description: Conflict. This occurs if the role is already disabled.

500.description: Internal server error. This occurs if there is an unexpected error while disabling the role.

put.description: Enables a role by its ID, making it available for assignment to users. Only disabled custom roles can be enabled. System/default roles are always enabled.

parameters.description: Role ID to enable. Must be a valid UUID format.
parameters.name: id

400.description: Bad Request. This occurs if the 'id' path parameter is missing, empty, or not a valid UUID format.

403.description: Forbidden. This occurs if trying to modify a system/default role.

404.description: Not Found. This occurs if no role exists with the provided ID.

409.description: Conflict. This occurs if the role is already enabled.

500.description: Internal server error. This occurs if there is an unexpected error while enabling the role.

get.description: Retrieves all routes and permissions associated with a specific role by role ID. Returns detailed permission structure classified by HTTP methods (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, etc.), route information, role details, and processing timestamp. Supports both custom and system roles.

parameters.description: Role ID to retrieve permissions for. Must be a valid UUID format. Supports both custom and system role IDs.
parameters.name: id

200.description: Role permissions retrieved successfully. Data contains Routes (classified by method), RoutesJSON (formatted JSON string), RoleInfo, and ProcessedAt timestamp.

400.description: Bad Request. This occurs if the 'id' path parameter is missing, empty, or not a valid UUID format.

404.description: Not Found. This occurs if no role exists with the provided ID.

500.description: Internal server error. This occurs if there is an unexpected error while retrieving role permissions.

put.description: Adds or removes permissions from a role. Requires role name (role field), and lists of permissions to add (add_permissions) or remove (remove_permissions). Each permission includes route, methods array, and description.

parameters.description: Role ID to update permissions for. Must be a valid UUID format.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: Update Role Permissions Request. Requires 'role', 'add_permissions', and 'remove_permissions'.
parameters.name: request

400.description: Bad Request. This occurs if required fields are missing or invalid.

404.description: Not Found. This occurs if the role with the specified name doesn't exist.

409.description: Conflict. This occurs if trying to modify a default/system role.

422.description: Unprocessable Entity. This occurs if the request body cannot be parsed.

500.description: Internal server error. This occurs if there is an unexpected error while updating permissions.

get.description: Returns the details (name, email, roles) of the user currently authenticated via JWT token. Extracted from token claims. Returns 404 if user not found.

200.description: User details successfully retrieved with name, email, and roles array

401.description: Unauthorized, invalid or missing JWT authentication

404.description: User not found in the system

500.description: Internal server error

put.description: Allows the authenticated user to update their profile information (name, email, or password). At least one field must be provided. User ID extracted from JWT token.

parameters.description: Fields to update (email, name, password). At least one field required. All fields are optional pointers.
parameters.name: request

400.description: Bad request, no fields provided for update

401.description: Unauthorized, invalid or missing JWT authentication

500.description: Internal server error

post.description: Initiates password reset by creating a reset token valid for 15 minutes. Returns OTP/token in response (should be sent via email in production). User must exist in the authenticated tenant.

parameters.description: Password reset request with 'email' field
parameters.name: request

200.description: Password reset token generated successfully. Response contains OTP in message field.

400.description: Bad request, email field is required or user not found with provided email

500.description: Internal server error during token generation

put.description: Sets a new password after verifying OTP token. Requires email, OTP (from reset request), new_password, and confirm_password. Passwords must match. OTP expires after 15 minutes.

parameters.description: OTP verification with fields: email, otp, new_password, confirm_password (all required)
parameters.name: request

400.description: Bad request, missing required fields (email, otp, new_password, or confirm_password)

404.description: User not found with provided email

409.description: Conflict, passwords don't match or OTP expired/invalid

500.description: Internal server error during password update

get.description: Fetches the details of a user by their unique user ID. This endpoint is typically used by admins or services that need to look up users.

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the user to retrieve
parameters.name: id

500.description: Internal server error

delete.description: Permanently deletes a user from the system using their unique identifier (UUID). User must belong to the authenticated tenant. Cannot be undone.

parameters.description: User ID (UUID format)
parameters.name: id

200.description: User successfully deleted with confirmation message

400.description: Bad request, 'id' path parameter is missing or empty

404.description: User not found with provided ID in the authenticated tenant

500.description: Internal server error during deletion

put.description: Assigns a specific role (role name as string) to a user identified by their user ID. Role must exist in the system. Only users with admin privileges can perform this action.

parameters.description: Unique identifier (UUID) of the user to assign a role
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: Role assignment details with 'role' field (role name string)
parameters.name: request

400.description: Bad request, 'role' field is required and cannot be empty

500.description: Internal server error

get.description: Fetches a list of all users for the authenticated tenant. Returns user details including id, email, name, created_at (RFC3339), and roles array. Client-side pagination applied (page 1, size 5).

200.description: Users list successfully retrieved with client-side pagination metadata

404.description: No users found for the authenticated tenant

500.description: Internal server error during user retrieval

put.description: Disables a user account, preventing them from accessing the system. Returns 400 if user is already disabled. User must belong to the authenticated tenant. Existing sessions remain valid until expiry.

parameters.description: Unique identifier (UUID) of the user to disable
parameters.name: id

200.description: User account disabled successfully with confirmation message

400.description: Bad request, 'id' is missing/empty OR user is already disabled

404.description: User not found with provided ID in the authenticated tenant

500.description: Internal server error during status update

put.description: Enables a previously disabled user account, allowing them to access the system again. Returns 400 if user is already enabled. User must belong to the authenticated tenant.

parameters.description: Unique identifier (UUID) of the user to enable
parameters.name: id

200.description: User account enabled successfully with confirmation message

400.description: Bad request, 'id' is missing/empty OR user is already enabled

404.description: User not found with provided ID in the authenticated tenant

500.description: Internal server error during status update

message.example: Bad request. Missing or invalid required fields.
Conflict. Resource already exists or operation conflicts with current state.
Invalid request body format. Please check your JSON syntax and field types.
Unauthorized access. Please provide valid authentication credentials.
